Name: 0_cardiogenic shock_cath lab_right side_hemodynamic support
Representation: ['cardiogenic shock', 'cath lab', 'right side', 'hemodynamic support', 'complete revascularization', 'coronary artery', 'best outcomes', 'acute kidney', 'patient ejection', 'emergent patients']
Representative_Docs: ["Historically, Impella was primarily reimbursed in one category, DRG 216. Over the last 18 months, the AHA Coding Clinic updated Impella to four specific categories: DRG's 216 to 221 for the cath lab, DRG 215 for care in the ICU, DRG 1 and 2 for biventricular support, and DRG's 268 and 269 for transfer of patients to specialized heart recovery hospitals", 'Additionally, on the CMS front, the American Hospital Association and CMS have now facilitated a system of care around the utilization of percutaneous heart pumps for Impella FDA indications for high-risk PCI, AMI cardiogenic shock, and right ventricular support', 'So, first on Protected PCI and AMI cardiogenic shock']
